name: Premiere Pro CC 2017
subtitle: Video Editing Application
description: In this course, users will learn foundations for capturing video and how to edit in Premiere Pro, the leading video editing software from the Adobe Creative Cloud suite. Topics include importing media, using the timeline, adding transitions and effects, mixing audio, color correction, and exporting options.
descriptionMD: In this course, users will learn foundations for capturing video and how to edit in Premiere Pro, the leading video editing software from the Adobe Creative Cloud suite. Topics include importing media, using the timeline, adding transitions and effects, mixing audio, color correction, and exporting options.

episodes.title: Read Me
episodes.description: James and Vonne introduce commonly used terminology for working in video editing and Premiere Pro.

episodes.title: Getting Started in Premiere Pro
episodes.description: In this episode, James and Vonne discuss the basics for getting started in Premiere Pro by exploring the different settings when you first launch the program and create a new file. They also determine why it is best to use the media browser in Premiere Pro rather than the Finder and explain the concepts of scratch disks and ingest media.

episodes.title: Project Organization
episodes.description: Organizing media for your Premiere Pro project is an important first step to making a great video. This episode explores the project panel, the source monitor panel, and the program monitor in the Premiere Pro interface. We also determine why blue is so important to notice in working within the panels.

episodes.title: Even More Project Organization
episodes.description: In this episode, James and Vonne take a deeper dive into organizing projects, introduce the left side vs the right side, and add custom meta data columns to items in the project panel.

episodes.title: The Source Monitor
episodes.description: In this episode, we examine the source monitor panel buttons, options, shortcuts for previewing clips, adding in and out points, and creating segments to add to the project panel. James also demonstrates how to create custom keyboard shortcuts in Premiere Pro.

episodes.title: Our First Story
episodes.description: We begin creating our first edited story by adding clips to the timeline. James shows different ways to drag and drop into the timeline or the program panel as well as using keyboard shortcuts for adding clips to insert, overwrite, overlay, replace, and insert before/after into the sequence.

episodes.title: Navigating the Timeline
episodes.description: In this episode, James and Vonne review different options for navigating in the timeline. James demonstrates how to work with linked clips and how to isolate video from audio. He also shows how to trim and edit audio tracks.

episodes.title: Simple Titles
episodes.description: In this episode, James adds a simple title to the timeline in our first edited story using the legacy title tool and creates a simple opacity fade using keyframes.

episodes.title: Simple Export
episodes.description: In this episode, we examine the presets and options for exporting a project in Premiere Pro, including the time tuner option. We also discuss the ripple trim tool for trimming clips in the timeline.

episodes.title: Adding Transitions
episodes.description: James shows off his fun gadgets for shooting video with a smart phone and how to add transitions to sequences. He reviews timeline options in Premiere Pro preferences, hotkeys for inserting clips for the source panel to the timeline, and options for working in the panels to modify transition settings.  James also covers how to manage panels and workspace presets as well as create custom workspaces.

episodes.title: Simple Trimming
episodes.description: In this episode, James and Vonne discuss trimming techniques using hotkeys, editing in trim mode, the importance of the K key, and playback options in the preferences.

episodes.title: Adding Effects
episodes.description: In this episode, James and Vonne discuss the reasons how to replace footage from the project panel, interpret footage for speed effects, snapping of the playhead in the preferences, match frame for creating effects, and effects parameters in the effects panel.

episodes.title: Working with Stills
episodes.description: In this episode, James and Vonne work with still images in Premiere Pro. They cover how to import a folder of images, modify stills duration in the preferences, and add stills to the timeline. They also demonstrate how to add markers in a clip and a sequence, then add images to the markers through the automate to sequence command. Finally, they show how to animate stills using effects parameters.

episodes.title: Speed Effects
episodes.description: Vonne and James continue with more effects, specifically covering speed effects. James demonstrates how to modify clip speed/duration, the rate stretch tool, and time remapping. They also cover advanced workspace manipulation.

episodes.title: Color Correction
episodes.description: In this episode, James and Vonne dive into the world of color correction in Premiere Pro. They review the lumetri scope panel and how to read the graphs. They also demonstrate how to use the basic correction, creative, and curves panels within the lumetri color panel group.

episodes.title: Even More Color Correction
episodes.description: In this episode, James and Vonne continue to explore how to color correct in Premiere Pro. They demonstrate how to use the color wheels, HSL secondary, and vignette panels within the lumetri color panel group. They also cover adjustment layers and review some obsolete effects.

episodes.title: Essential Sound Editing
episodes.description: James and Vonne cover the essentials of sound editing. They review the audio settings in the preferences, the merge clips command, and the audio track mixer. They also cover how to add effects and create a live mix in the audio track mixer.

episodes.title: Make it Pop
episodes.description: Make it pop! This is every designer or editor’s favorite request. In this episode, James demonstrates some fun tips and tricks while combining and expanding upon all the skills covered in the previous episodes so far in the series. He explores the shadow highlight effect, creating a vignette using the legacy vignette using the legacy title tool and opacity, and nesting clips.

episodes.title: Mulitcamera Editing
episodes.description: In this episode, James and Vonne discuss how to setup a shoot with multiple cameras and creating a multicamera source sequence in Premiere Pro. James also demonstrates how to edit in real time with the multicamera view in the program monitor.

episodes.title: 360 Degree Video
episodes.description: 360 degree video is the new wild wild west of video editing.  In this episode, James introduces how Premiere Pro works with 360 video and audio. He discusses creating a new VR sequence and its settings, switching VR display mode in the program panel, adding the binaural effect on the master track in the track mixer, adding the panner ambisonic effect on the track in the timeline, and exporting options.

episodes.title: Timelapse
episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and James show how to create a timelapse video by importing an image sequence.

episodes.title: Step Up Your Input and Output
episodes.description: There are other programs within the Creative Cloud that can help step up your productivity. In this episode, James demonstrates how Prelude CC can assist in inputting media as well as Media Encoder to help with outputting finished sequences. He also reviews the remove unused command, the project manager, and how to create new ingest presets.

episodes.title: Outside Help
episodes.description: There is an app for that! James shows off some of his favorite apps for mobile devices to assist in shooting and editing video.
